entry.title: Analysis on the Development Application at 467 New Canterbury Road Dulwich Hill
entry.summary: Download Applications and Consents DA200900093 467 New Canterbury - redacted Mr Smith, A quick perusal of the application for the use of 467 Canterbury road raises some VERY serious questions. 1. The application is erroneous, incorrectly completed and incomplete. The First question, "previous contact with council has not been answered????"...

content.div:
Download Applications and Consents DA200900093 467 New Canterbury - redacted Mr Smith,
A quick perusal of the application for the use of 467 Canterbury road raises some VERY serious questions.
1. The application is erroneous, incorrectly completed and incomplete.
The First question, "previous contact with council has not been answered????" this question must be answered, it goes to conflict of interest and upholds councils code of conduct.
2. Q3 description of the Proposal is WRONG, it must be marked "USE OF LAND/BUILDING", this applications as you will see, seeks to "change the use of the building from office to massage."
3. Q4. Wow......this is totally erroneous.
The Development Application FEE is calculated on a sliding scale that relies on the total cost of the proposed development. To suggest all the electrical work, partitioning, fit-out, painting, furniture, waste disposal etc etc etc in addition to the essential services as required by the BCA (Building code of Australia) and required by the development consent approval will COST the grand total of $1550.00 is a travesty ... that is totally absurd.
How did any council officer accept and process the application when the existing floor plan clearly shows an open office area and the proposed floor plan shows a very extensive fit out for the grand sum of $1550.00
It is difficult to understand how this application made it all the way to approval been given:
the application is incorrectly completed,
the application is not fully completed,
the cost of the development is substantially understated and should have been no less than $30k - $50k depending on the quality of the fitout.
These are very serious errors that highlight serious flaws in councils internal processes or worse still may have involved some sort of Corruption.
4. I note the description of the proposal on the application also includes "PLUS STANDARD DELUXE MANICURE & PEDICURE", this opens whole new assessment process in terms of Health requirements.
http://www0.health.nsw.gov.au/factsheets/environmental/nail_treatment_2012.html
Nail treatment (manicures and pedicures) - hygiene standards
Nail technicians can carry out a variety of different procedures, many of which involve 'skin penetration'. Because 'skin penetration' carries a risk of infection, the premises and procedures where skin penetration is conducted must comply with the Public Health Regulation, 2012. (open Link below)
ALSO "Are these premises registered as required by law?????"
Premises - registration, construction and materials
â€¢ All nail technicians that carry out skin penetration procedures, must be registered with the local council. Notification forms are available from the NSW Health Public Health Legislation webpage at: www.health.nsw.gov.au/phact
5. What information was included with the application to satisfy council that the proposal would comply with the latter state health requirements?
What details were included of disposal of waste material?
What details were supplied for laundry of towels etc?
Is the premises registered as legally required?
have any inspections since the date of consent been conducted by council's health officer?
6. Q8 confirms the premises was previously an office.
Why has the last question page 4 relating to the use of the building been ignored and left unanswered?
This application is legally "for a change of use of the premises" yet the applicant has avoided answering the questions on 2 occasions.?? and has infact ticked the box marked OTHER.
WHY has the assessing officer not asked for the application to be fully completed so it may be lawfully processes? officers?
In fact look at the description stated on the actual development consent granted by council
"Pursuant to Section 81 of the Act, notice is hereby given of the determination by the Council of
Development Application No. 200900093 to carry out alterations to the premises and to use
the ground floor shop for therapeutic and remedial massage and a beauty salon relating to
property situated at......."
Quite Bizarre as the applicant makes no mention of alterations or change of use and stated the cost of the development is $1550.00
7. Q9. Is not fully answered and it should have detailed that building work will be done to facilitate the fit out and contradicts the description in the consent
8. Q9. should have detailed the hours of operation correctly NOT "as above"
Also the questions to the number of employees is marked as two in one answer and then - "indicating zero"
9. Why has the waste management plan been accepted without the applicants signing the declaration????
10. Was a CONSTRUCTION CERTIFICATE application to cover the fit out of the premises lodged and approved??
The Relevant Condition on the Development consent read as follows:
"BEFORE THE ISSUE OF A CONSTRUCTION CERTIFICATE
For the purpose of interpreting this consent the Certifying Authority (Council or an
Accredited Certifier) is that person appointed to issue the Construction Certificate.
26. Before the issue of a Construction Certificate an amended plan shall be submitted to
and accepted by the Certifying Authority (Council or an Accredited Certifier) indicating
the existing building upgraded to comply with the provisions of the Building Code of
Australia in relation to:
a) smoke detection systems;
b) portable extinguishers; and
c) solid core doors.
Reason: To ensure the building is suitable for the proposed use.
27. Before the issue of a Construction Certificate the owner or builder shall sign a written
undertaking that they shall be responsible for the full cost of repairs to footpath, kerb and
gutter, or other Council property damaged as a result of construction of the proposed
development. Council may utilise part or all of any Building Security Deposit (B.S.D.) or
recover in any court of competent jurisdiction, any costs to Council for such repairs.
Reason: To ensure that all damages arising from the building works are repaired at
no cost to Council"
11. The section 96 application you posted on line purported to have been lodged to mitigate traffic noise as justification to use the rear rooms. This is totally is misleading, in reality it was an application to expand or intensify the business contrary to the following condition of consent on the original approval.
Condition 2 of the consent make it very clear
""The area to be used for the use approved in this consent being restricted to the ground floor shop, with the remainder of the premises being used solely as a single dwelling".
The section 96 application that you posted, ""under description was legally required to state it in description of proposal "it is an application to "AMEND Condition 2 of the Development consent and expand the business to the rear flat"
This application appears legally FLAWED, council should now review this consent with a view of rescinding the entire approval.
The processing officer(s) and team leader need to be made to front to a disciplinary interview to respond to the above matters and ascertain why this incomplete erroneous application was approved let alone accepted in that form.
One would reasonably expect the team leader not to sign off on the consent and demand all these matters are addressed or simply reject the application.
NO Council is "legally allowed to process any incomplete or inaccurate application under any circumstances.
Who processed this application? ... this is really wrong!!!
I assumed from this plan the SEC 96 application was to use the area marked as "TEA room" to expand the business.
Hence the conclusion it would constitute an intensification of a use that was the subject of development consent issued on an incomplete and erroneous application.
This MUST BE REFERRED TO ICAC.

entry.title: Meanwhile, Julia Gillard was campaigning for the Senate. Or working at Slater and Gordon. Or doing the weeding. Or helping Bruce sell Kerr Street or something.
entry.summary: Do other countries have this drama with their Prime Minister? Slater and Gordon is on the record - "In September 1995 Ms Gillard took a leave of absence from Slater & Gordon in order to campaign for the Senate". Remember Slater and Gordon made that statement on Sunday, 19 August,...
entry.content:
Do other countries have this drama with their Prime Minister?

Slater and Gordon is on the record - "In September 1995 Ms Gillard took a leave of absence from Slater & Gordon in order to campaign for the Senate".

Remember Slater and Gordon made that statement on Sunday, 19 August, 2012.  Julia Gillard needed a cover story and Slater and Gordon delivered one.  

Peter Gordon and Nick Styant Browne are in accord that Gillard elected to resign after her disciplinary hearing on 11 September, 1995 - and not "in order to campaign for the Senate".

On 15 October, 1995 Ebru Yaman's article about Gillard appeared in The Australian newspaper.  Gillard said, "I'm still a partner with Slater and Gordon and I have no intention of leaving".

Now let's look at her biographical notes, here are some extracts:



Right, so the version for the archives says she started with Brumby in 1995 (while she was campaigning for the Senate).   And according to The Australian she was still with Slater and Gordon as a partner and had no intention of leaving.

This bio is similar from the APH handbook


And this one is from the APH website


Right.   Not campaigning for the Senate.   Working for Brumby in 1995.   Except that's bulltish too, she started in May, 1996.   

So maybe she'd tell the Young Lawyer magazine the truth - as an example to say aspiring women who might be looking for a role model.

Nope - that's full of bulltish too.   This photo predates botox.


For sheer lying chutzpah, how's this exposition of the pain of making that decision to leave Slater and Gordon to campaign for the Senate, or to run Brumby's office or to watch Oprah.


CEOs who lie like this in their CVs generally get picked up.   Surely to God someone in the Labor Party checked and saw that she had something to hide!

entry.title: How did Ms Gillard got away with it for so long! How come no one called her out, it's so obvious.
entry.summary: Last week we spoke about the weekend of 18/19 August 2012 when Hedley Thomas published the Slater and Gordon/Gillard record of interview, Paul Kelly and Peter Van Onselen hosted Ms Gillard on Australian Agenda on Sky - and then Slater and Gordon staff concocted a manifestly dubious media statement to...
entry.content:
Last week we spoke about the weekend of 18/19 August 2012 when Hedley Thomas published the Slater and Gordon/Gillard record of interview, Paul Kelly and Peter Van Onselen hosted Ms Gillard on Australian Agenda on Sky - and then Slater and Gordon staff concocted a manifestly dubious media statement to advance Ms Gillard's personal interests.

With her background of bulltish that weekend should have been it and it may well have been if Slater and Gordon's current management had not been so helpful with the media statement.

Here are the links to last week's posts:

http://www.michaelsmithnews.com/2013/03/what-slater-and-gordon-says-is-a-matter-for-slater-and-gordon-and-julia-gillards-former-flatmate-jul.html

http://www.michaelsmithnews.com/2013/03/gillards-co-ordinated-activity-with-slater-and-gordon-to-concoct-a-false-statement-made-to-her-benef.html

http://www.michaelsmithnews.com/2013/03/slater-and-gordon-response-regarding-its-media-statement-of-20-august-2012.html

So our last public correspondence with Slater and Gordon last week ended like this:

 

And finally, is the Slater and Gordon statement that Julia Gillard "took a leave of absence in order to campaign for the Senate" in 1995 a true statement?
Yes.
Regards 
Hamish
             Hamish Heard
Senior Media Advisor SLATER & GORDON LAWYERS
485 La Trobe St, Melbourne VIC 3000T: slatergordon.com.au facebook.com/SlaterGordonAU twitter.com/SlaterGordon
ENDS
I followed that email with this note to Slater and Gordon
Hamish,
Thank you for your speedy response.
May I try to clear up Slater and Gordon's official position on the substantive reason for Ms Gillard leaving the firm?
In late 1995, had Ms Gillard's "relationship with the equity partnership group become fractured, and trust and confidence evaporated" making it untenable that she continue in her employment?
Was the firm "concerned as to whether (Ms Gillard) had acted consistently with (her) obligations of utmost good faith with regard to her partners" and was her resignation accepted in those circumstances?
Did the partnership "consider terminating Ms Gillard" and in those circumstances did "Ms Gillard elect to resign"  and did the partnership "accept her resignation without discussion"?

Was it "clear that  the  relationships had broken down irretrievably" between Ms Gillard and the remaining partners in the partnership?

Slater and Gordon's public statement of 20 August, 2012 gives the impression that the substantive underlying reason for Ms Gillard's absence from the firm from September 1995 was "in order (for her) to campaign for the Senate".   Is that the major contributing reason for Julia Gillard's absence from the firm from September, 1995?

Finally, is Slater and Gordon aware of any reason, order or agreement of any nature that would restrict Ms Gillard from practicing as a lawyer at any time in Victoria?
ENDS

 

Now here is some news!   As you know I was crook late last week, during that time Slater and Gordon have responded to our questions.

Here is the response from Slater and Gordon:

We stand by the previous public statements we have made regarding this issue".

So we have the law firm's current management coming in to work on a Sunday when Julia Gillard needs a positive media statement.    Together with Ms Gillard they concoct a statement that protects Ms Gillard.   Don't you wish they'd just told the truth?   

Next we'll look closely at those 6 months that Slater and Gordon says Ms Gillard was campaigning for the Senate.
